name: The Eldritch Cases: Dagon - A Lovecraft horror adventure
blurb: The Eldritch Cases: Dagon is a 3rd person horror point&click adventure based on H.P. Lovecraft's Cthulhu mythos. Win/Mac/Linux/Android

rewards.reward:
The early Shoggoth catches your sanity:
You are faster than your slow human fellows, and as such you'll get all the rewards from the £10 tier for only £7.
Go get em!
(~$11 / €8)

Cultist:
You believe in the Order.
In return, you get a DRM free download version of the game once it's finished for a platform of your choice (Windows/Mac/Linux). You'll also get access to the developer forum and 3 HD wallpapers for your viewing pleasure.
(If the game gets greenlit on Steam you will also have the choice of a Steam key in addition to the normal download)
(~$16 / €12)

The Unnamable: From here on, your name will appear in the backer credits in the game! Also, you will be able to take part in polls during the development and help deciding over character looks, user interface and so on\r\n(~$25 / \u20ac18)
From Beyond:\r\nYou sneak up from beyond to snatch the \u00a325 tier before anyone else can. A bit rude! But hey, you're not here to win a popularity contest, right?\r\n(~$33 / \u20ac24)

Erich Zann:\r\nIn addition to the previous rewards you also get the a digital download version of the Soundtrack. You can use it as an aural background for your sinister rituals, or when you are doing the laundry.\r\n(~$41 / \u20ac30)

Innsmouth Tourist:\r\nYou look a little lost, and as such you will receive a digital Innsmouth Town Guide for Tourists (pdf, 24 pages). The guide feature information about Innsmouth's history, background information of the main characters of the game and a lot of pretty pictures for those of you that don't like reading. Also all previous rewards.\r\n(~$50 / \u20ac36)

Lurker at the Threshold:\r\nYour curiosity always gets you into trouble, such as having to play the first chapter of the game long before the rest of the world.You will be able to give feedback at this point and influence the further development, in return you will be listed as a beta tester in the game credits. You can even put that on your CV! Also all previous rewards.\r\n(~$67 / \u20ac48)

Justin Geoffrey: \r\nYou are either one of the unfortunate, long forgotten inhabitants of Innsmouth Hospital for the Criminally Insane whose only trace left is an entry in the in official register, or one of the many happy guests of the Gilman House Hotel who left their name in the guestbook! Also all previous rewards (~$84/\u20ac60)

The King in Yellow:
All digital rewards (the game, soundtrack, tourist guide and wallpapers) but in physical! On a USB flash drive! With the game's logo on it! OR alternatively a DVD version. Tell us which one you prefer after the campaign is over!
And yes, I know that naming this reward The King In Yellow doesn't make any sense, but what can you do!
(This tier includes the download versions as well of course)
(~$108 / €78)

Friedrich Wilhelm von Junzt: Occult books play a big role in Lovecraft's universe, and you will become the author of one that is featured in the game. You can find these books in Dr. West's library, and the best part: don't even need to write it, we just slap your name on it!

Also all previous rewards.
(~$125 / €90)

Charles Dexter Ward: Your name will appear ingame on a gravestone on Innsmouth's lovely graveyard.

Plus all rewards of the £65 pledge.
(~$167 / €120)

Pickman's model: Does your madness shine bright? A part of Dr. West's portrait gallery is devoted to famous madmen and women, and your face can become part of this unique collection: Send us a photo, and we will work it into a painting and display your name and the story of your particular horrific history.\r\nPlus all rewards of the \u00a365 pledge.\r\n(~$250 / \u20ac180)

It's dead, Jim: Your rotting corpse in one of the  7 mortuary chambers in Dr. West's morgue. With your name and cause of death (of your choice (within reason)) written on the door! Plus all rewards of the \u00a365 pledge.\r\n(~$335 / \u20ac240)

The Old One: A NPC will be modelled and named after you and become part of the story. No work on your end needed, because the NPC is - this is a Lovecraft story after all - already dead. He/She will appear in a flashback, ingame documents, and have both a painting and the most pompous tombs on Innsmouth's cemetery. 

Plus all rewards of the £65 pledge.
(~$586 / €422)

The not so evil clergyman: \r\nEven the greatest heroes need some help from time to time, and fortunately not everyone in and around Innsmouth has already signed up for the Dark Side(\u2122)! You will become a NPC with text in the game, modelled after your appearance (or description) who carries your name and will be actively involved in a part of the story. You will also have your portrait in the game, albeit in different places depending on the background of your NPC \r\nAlso all rewards from the \u00a365 tier. Shipping included. (~$840/\u20ac607)

Mr. or Mrs. Marsh: It is all your fault. You created the Esoteric Order of Dagon and made Innsmouth the town it is today. For that, there will be a huge statue of you right in the center of New Church Green for everyone to see and admire. The statue will be modelled after your photo and contain a name plate with your name and a message of your choice (within reason :-) ). Shipping included. Also all the rewards of the \u00a365 pledge (~$1260 / \u20ac910)

Nyarlathotep: This is the ultimate tier. You become The Producer(\u2122) of The Eldritch Cases: Dagon! Your name will appear in the opening credits as Producer, as well as on the game box, website, IMDB, Mobygames and everywhere else. You can use your name, company logo or both for this. Your friends will all go \u201cOooooh\u201d and \u201cAaaaah\u201d when they hear about this, and they will invite you to fancy dinner parties and what not! This tier also includes your portrait in the gallery and everything from the \u00a365 tier (~$4200 / \u20ac3030)
